text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new one o
tricks point never album r+ 7 1 o tricks
point never is the pseudonym of
electronic music composer Daniel o
Patton whose productions usually sit on
the experimental side of things
embracing elements of ambient music of
progressive synth music of drone of a
little bit of noise a lot of the time
the music he makes kind of sits
somewhere between being somewhat epic
and grand and also very Spacey or
numbing he's also collaborated with
quite a few artists and put out some
side projects as well one of which and
is kind of credited with starting this
whole vaporwave thing the project that I
failed to mention in my review of
OneNote explained ever is last
full-length LP replica but now that
replica has been mentioned I have to say
that that is my favorite album to come
out of this project thus far mostly
because I think that record takes such a
strange unique and obtuse approach to
producing sample-based music it's just
like listening to these very somewhat
ambient but odd and weirdly shaped
plunder phonics compositions I'm finding
are plus seven to be a continuation of
this trend in Daniels music to produce
stuff that is a bit more engaging is
more eventful is more detailed
however stylistically I find him
drifting away from the samples upon
samples upon samples that made replicas
such a sonic treasure trove I have no
clue what happened to my mouth right
there instead of relying heavily on
samples Daniel kind of rests on his
laurels and goes back to using
synthesizers really heavily which sound
like they're produced via MIDI
sequencing kind of a calling card for
Daniel at this point I guess what I'm
trying to say is that Daniels music
feels like it's entirely generated
inside of some computer program to the
point where it just does not feel human
anymore
however still our plus seven is
is kind of change for Daniel because I
do think he puts in a lot more effort
into finding some synth textures on on
this record that yes while they do feel
like they are composed in this very
rigid way sonically it's it's very lush
plus I would say that Daniels songs are
pretty structured on this album as well
not meandering so much not really kind
of spacing out so much even when he
seems to build up to a moment he kind of
takes it away really quickly and goes
down a completely different Road
compositionally I feel like Daniel jumps
all over the place but sonically a lot
of what he pulls together is is very
pretty
it's very heavenly actually when it
comes to synth textures on this record
anyway I would say that Daniels number
one influence is like cheesy kitschy
new-age music from the 80s and 90s but
he does it with a slightly experimental
angle with kind of a progressive angle
to the point where maybe we're listening
to like post New Age here take the
obviously synth generated chorus vocals
what sounds like a children's chorus on
the track chrome County which has these
very relaxing sweet instrumental swells
but then as the song progresses
Daniel grabs these synth generated
chorus vocals and stretches them out
samples them and just slows them down to
the point where you're getting these
digital noisy just hissy stretch marks
Daniels music can be kind of seductive
but it can also be very otherworldly and
and kind of like you're in the midst of
this odd weird cuckoo-land where nothing
makes sense like how he finishes this
track up with this really epic grand
organ solo that sounds amazing really
moving but then as soon as it comes up
it's like he just kind of fades the
track out and cuts it down and just lets
the album close which is sort of how the
first track on here ends as well which
is another track that I like we have the
song Americans on here which I feel like
borrows from this cheesy sense of
relaxation by incorporating these just
very commercial sounding synthesizers
that are also simultaneously dated and
like these jungle sounds there are these
fake synth horns all over the track too
but then sort of thrown into this mix
that I would normally cringe at are
these very tightly composed like
progressive synthesizer arpeggios that
make the track feel really primal it's
an interesting juxtaposition of ideas
but then around the 1 minute and 30
second mark of this track this music
just starts to melt away into these
somewhat jittery sounds that are kind of
unpredictable and popping up and
snapping at me really quickly the track
eventually turns to its original sound
and then kind of cuts things off and I
don't know I feel like I'm left wanting
more at the end of this song and a lot
of other songs here too but then again a
lot of what Daniel is doing on this
album and maybe this is kind of an issue
I had with replicas as well a lot of
what's here is so unorthodox whose
really to say how long or how short it
should be all I know is that there are
some tracks on here that I feel are
maybe just completely uninteresting
because of how short they are songs like
he-she or cryo which to me don't even
ever really get started into something
that I would want to return to they
don't even really fade into the
following tracks all that well so I it's
hard for me to sort of see what they do
for this album I find tracks on here
like zebra the the six-minute highlight
off this record so much more interesting
with it's really jittery synthetic
opening with all these skipping tones
it's really quickly skipping all I know
is the tracks like this seemed to me
like this really odd little gadget or
toy that I don't know what its purpose
is but I could just stare at it and just
kind of like move it click it this way
and then this weird thing pops out and
it's just puzzling and maybe this entire
album itself could be sort of perceived
in that light too but I guess that
doesn't stop me from thinking that some
of this album's tracks or functions are
less exciting than others I'm a little
all over the place with this album in
terms of what songs I like what songs I
don't and I seem to dislike some like
others for completely different reasons
because of how different these songs
feel and tone in vibe and sound and I
like that daniel has come together with
a record that
so many of the songs here come from
totally different worlds and yet they
all feel like they're a part of our +7
nothing on this album sticks out to me
as like whoa this doesn't belong here or
this just doesn't stick with the whole
theme or this doesn't really I guess I
just don't find the tracks the content
within the theme and the aura in the
world that he creates on this record to
be entertaining from beginning to end
much of the time they are which is why I
guess I'm feeling a light too decent six
on this thing transition but if you've
given this one o tricks play never
record to listen what did you think of
it did you love it hate it why what do
you think I should review next and
that's it Anthony Fantana R + 7 the
needle drop forever
